Title: Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content
Description:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization is searching for an analyst to understand and quantify opportunities for delivering value to creators. This individual will leverage internal and external data sources to define program strategy, support and improve the team's process, and measure program performance for future iteration, all with the goal of helping thousands of partners meet their desired outcomes. Ideal candidate is a team player and loves breaking down problems, building solutions, delivering actionable and data-driven insights, and working in a changing environment.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:


Develop data centric strategies to drive effective scaled programs for partners across lead acquisition, product engagement and growth education.
Work with program managers to help define strategy, create metrics to evaluate success and measure impact of outreach channels and service models for business critical early stage creators.
Analyze and rigorously measure results and make data-driven recommendations for optimization of future programs and campaigns.
Understand partner performance, collaborating with key stakeholders to inform & understand analyses by providing suggestions for best metrics to be used.
Build data pipelines, queries, and reporting from multiple data sources (internal and external) to generate partner dataset for marketing and program managers to leverage.


Minimum Qualifications:


BA or BS degree
3+ years experience with SQL (Oracle, Vertica, Hive, MySQL, etc)
3+ years experience with Python
3+ years of experience in data analytics roles
Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience leveraging methods such as A/B test, matching model, Difference in Difference for causal discovery
Experience with programming languages such as R or Python to build statistical models
Experience at a consumer technology or media company
Experience in growing scalable programs for Sales or Partnerships teams
Experience working in organizations with cross functional teams
Experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative in dynamic environments
Experience to multi-task and adapt well to changing environment


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

HTML:
The Global Partnerships & Content organization at Meta works closely with the leading content creators and media entities in the world to build and grow innovative and meaningful content and community engagement experiences across a variety of product areas. The Strategy & Operations team within the Global Partnerships & Content organization is searching for an analyst to understand and quantify opportunities for delivering value to creators. This individual will leverage internal and external data sources to define program strategy, support and improve the team's process, and measure program performance for future iteration, all with the goal of helping thousands of partners meet their desired outcomes. Ideal candidate is a team player and loves breaking down problems, building solutions, delivering actionable and data-driven insights, and working in a changing environment.

Data Analyst, Global Partnerships & Content Responsibilities:

  • Develop data centric strategies to drive effective scaled programs for partners across lead acquisition, product engagement and growth education.
  • Work with program managers to help define strategy, create metrics to evaluate success and measure impact of outreach channels and service models for business critical early stage creators.
  • Analyze and rigorously measure results and make data-driven recommendations for optimization of future programs and campaigns.
  • Understand partner performance, collaborating with key stakeholders to inform & understand analyses by providing suggestions for best metrics to be used.
  • Build data pipelines, queries, and reporting from multiple data sources (internal and external) to generate partner dataset for marketing and program managers to leverage.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA or BS degree
  • 3+ years experience with SQL (Oracle, Vertica, Hive, MySQL, etc)
  • 3+ years experience with Python
  • 3+ years of experience in data analytics roles
  • Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience leveraging methods such as A/B test, matching model, Difference in Difference for causal discovery
  • Experience with programming languages such as R or Python to build statistical models
  • Experience at a consumer technology or media company
  • Experience in growing scalable programs for Sales or Partnerships teams
  • Experience working in organizations with cross functional teams
  • Experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative in dynamic environments
  • Experience to multi-task and adapt well to changing environment

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst for a 12 month contract position with our client. This position is fully remote.

Summary:

We are looking for a Business and Data Intelligence Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will work with cross-functional partners and develop data foundations, data pipelines, data visualization assets and analysis to enable data-driven decision-making for the Customer Success organization. This is a 12-month contract role with a potential extension.

Primary Responsibilities:


Tool and Dashboard Development: Design, develop, and maintain data tools and analytics dashboards to automate processes and provide real-time insights into customer metrics and product usage.
Foundations and Pipeline Development: Write scalable and efficient SQL to encode business logic, and develop robust pipelines on the data stack.
Data Management: Establish robust data collection, storage, and quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability and accuracy of analyses.
Project Management: Lead data projects from inception to completion, aligning with strategic goals and ensuring delivery of measurable value to the organization.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross functional partners in customer success and adjacent teams to integrate data-driven insights into strategies and initiatives.
Continuous Learning and Innovation: Keep up with industry trends in data science and analytics to drive innovation and improve customer success outcomes.


Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative discipline
2+ years of experience with SQL/relational databases
2+ years of business analytics experience in a medium-to-large company with demonstrated ability to navigate complex data environments and provide guidance to business leaders
2+ years of relevant industry or relevant academia experience working with large amounts of data
2+ years experience in at least one programming languages (e.g., R, Python, Java, Scala, PHP, JavaScript)
2+ years of experience in data visualization and dashboard design
Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position.


Preferred Qualifications:


MS or PhD in a quantitative discipline: statistics, operations research, computer science, informatics, engineering,
Statistical modeling project experience with regression models, tree models
Data pipeline development experience
Experience with data modeling, ETL (Extraction, Transformation & Load) concepts, and patterns for efficient data governance.
Experience on a / adjacent to a Business Intelligence team
Self-starter, able to work independently but ask for guidance when needed
Ability to speak comfortably in a variety of settings including one-on-one and in front of large groups and adapt communication style for different audiences.


Suggested Skills:


SQL (Intermediate or advanced)
Data Program Management
Data Visualization and Dashboard Design


The hourly pay rate range for this position is $49.21 to $58.05

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Genesis10

Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.

For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10:


Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.
The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.
Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)
Behavioral Health Platform
Medical, Dental, Vision
Health Savings Account
Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident)
Voluntary Term Life Insurance
401K
Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)
Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)
Remote opportunities available


For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.

Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Data Analyst - 25564
Description:
CEIs Fortune 500 Client is a national leader in multi-department stores, and they are adding a Data Analyst to their team in Cincinnati.




12-month contract position with potential for extension and permanent conversion
Hybrid Position working 3 days onsite in Downtown Cincinnati (Mon, Tues, & Wed)
Pay Range of $40-$45 / HR + benefits (medical, dental, vision, and 401k)




Responsibilities:




Analyzing and generating reports on in-stock inventory, processes and ordering/buying trends
Comparing what stores ordered vs what their internal systems suggested they order- both outside inventory and deli/produce etc.
Analyst will be pulling and analyzing data in Azure/SQL Databases with a focus on data cleansing.
Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets.
Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives.
Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team.
Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.




Required Skills:




Must have 2 years of data analysis experience utilizing R or Python (ie. data cleansing, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis or similar experience)
Power BI experience is required (Almost all of the data reporting is done in Power BI).
Basic understanding of SQL Querying is required.
Ideal candidate has experience working with some of the following: Retail Data, Process improvement, or Supply Chain data.
Associate degree in related field or relevant experience.







As a trusted technology partner, CEI delivers solutions that help our customers transform their business and achieve meaningful results. From strategy and custom application development through application management - our technology and digital experience services are tailored to meet each unique need of our customers. Our staffing solutions bring specialized skills to complement our customers' workforce and project requirements.

Show more

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Estamos buscando un Digital Data Analyst para el equipo Customer Insights para trabajar en el área de Digital en Desigual. La función principal será el desarrollo, análisis, mejora y mantenimiento de dashboards que ayuden en analizar y comprender el negocio.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




4-day work-week: trabajamos 34 horas dentro de una semana laboral de 4 días para potenciar la creatividad y la conciliación. Además, contamos con flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterráneo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.
Podrás flexibilizar tu salario destinándolo a servicios como seguro de salud, transporte, guardería y comida. Además, podrás disfrutar de café, infusiones y fruta fresca cada día.
Desigualiza tu armario: tendrás un 50% de descuento en nuestras colecciones.




Tus funciones principales serán…




Análisis de Métricas Digitales: Recopilar, limpiar y analizar datos de diversas plataformas digitales (Google Analytics, CRM, etc.) para medir el desempeño del negocio y las diferentes campañas.
Optimización del LTV del cliente: Analizar el comportamiento de los usuarios para identificar puntos de fricción y oportunidades de mejora en la experiencia de usuario.
Evaluación de Campañas Digitales: Medir y analizar la efectividad de las campañas de marketing digital (SEM, email marketing, publicidad en redes sociales) y realizar recomendaciones basadas en los datos para optimizar el retorno de inversión (ROI).
Monitoreo y Reportes en Tiempo Real: Configurar y mantener sistemas de monitoreo en tiempo real en Tableau para seguir el rendimiento de las estrategias y generar reportes periódicos para los equipos de digital, proporcionando insights accionables basados en los datos recopilados.
Valorable experiencia con dashboards en Tableau: Crear y mantener dashboards interactivos en Tableau que presenten métricas clave del desempeño (conversiones, tráfico web, engagement) de manera visual y comprensible.




¿Qué buscamos?




Grado en ingeniería, económicas, estadística, matemáticas o similares.
Experiencia con Google Analytics: Conocimiento de Google Analytics para rastrear y analizar métricas de rendimiento del sitio web, comportamiento del usuario y efectividad de las campañas digitales.
Competencia en Microsoft Excel: Sólido conocimiento de Excel, incluyendo el uso de funciones avanzadas, tablas dinámicas y macros para el análisis y presentación de datos.
Habilidades Analíticas y de Resolución de Problemas: Capacidad para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos, identificar tendencias, detectar problemas y proponer soluciones basadas en los datos.
Conocimientos en Marketing Digital y Comercio Electrónico: Entendimiento de las estrategias y tácticas de marketing digital, así como de las dinámicas del comercio electrónico, para contextualizar y aplicar los insights obtenidos de los datos en iniciativas prácticas y efectivas.
Valorable xperiencia en Herramientas de Análisis de Datos: Dominio de herramientas como Tableau para la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards interactivos. Capacidad para transformar datos complejos en visualizaciones claras y accionables.
Valorable conocimientos Avanzados de SQL: Habilidad para escribir consultas SQL complejas para extraer, manipular y analizar datos de diferentes bases de datos.
Valorable experiencia en optimización de consultas y manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos. Conocimientos de Big Query es un plus.
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA ANALYST - CONTROLLING

¿CÓMO SERIA TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Para formar parte de nuestro equipo de Reporting dentro del departamento de Control de gestión buscamos un/a Data Analyst.

Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones.

Funciones


Participarás en proyectos con el objetivo de simplificar el acceso a la información, generar valor con los datos y capacitar a los usuarios de herramientas para acelerar la toma de decisiones
Crearás una red de contactos multidisciplinares en la organización para garantizar el éxito de los proyectos
Darás soporte en la elaboración y análisis del reporting mensual financiero
Darás soporte en la creación y mantenimiento de dashboards en diferentes herramientas de BI: Looker, PowerBI y SAP BO
Liderarás la automatización y simplificación del reporting mensual financiero a través de PowerBI
Realizarás análisis complejos para permitir la toma de decisiones basada en datos
Sintetizarás los datos procedentes de múltiples fuentes y desarrollar hipótesis
Proporcionarás ideas clave, recomendaciones y presentarlas a los diferentes interlocutores


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Master en Ingeniería, ADE, Estadística o Matemáticas
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Análisis de datos, consultoría de BI o consultoría de negocio
Conocimientos en SQL, herramientas de BI y lenguajes de programación
Dominio de Excel
Buscamos personas con Learning Agility, influyentes, analíticas, rigurosas, con buenas dotes de comunicación, capacidad resolutiva y altamente orientada a cliente interno & negocio
Orientación a negocio y mentalidad resolutiva: capacidad de analizar, interpretar, sintetizar y comunicar impactos y tendencias a través de los datos


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso


You got it?

We like you!
Show more

  • Dominio de Excel
  • Buscamos personas con Learning Agility, influyentes, analíticas, rigurosas, con buenas dotes de comunicación, capacidad resolutiva y altamente orientada a cliente interno & negocio
  • Orientación a negocio y mentalidad resolutiva: capacidad de analizar, interpretar, sintetizar y comunicar impactos y tendencias a través de los datos

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?

  • Horario Flexible (entrada de 8h a 9h30 y salida de 17h a 18h30), jornada intensiva los viernes (de 8h a 9h hasta las 14h / 15h) y mayoría de vigilias de festivos
  • Posibilidad de Teletrabajo
  • Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home) además de un Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
  • Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería
  • Retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc.
  • Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés
  • Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo y cursos específicos en función de tus necesidades
  • Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings sobre transformación digital, moda y actividades de nuestros equipos
  • Servicio médico propio, servicio de fisioterapia una vez a la semana, sala de fitness y vestuarios en nuestras oficinas centrales
  • Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso

You got it?

We like you!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Marlex és una firma destacada en serveis professionals, especialitzada en oferir solucions solucions integrals de Recursos Humans en àmbits d’Interim, Recruiting i Executive. Amb més de 25 anys d’experiència en el sector, hem establert una xarxa que abarca més de 70 oficines, consolidant-nos com una de les cinc principals firmes de la península.

Actualment busquem un/a Junior Data Analyst per incorporar a les nostres oficines de Serveis Corporatius a Sant Cugat.

Funcions:

Com a membre de l’equip de Data, t’encarregaràs de:


Col·laborar amb els departaments implicats per comprendre les seves necessitats d’anàlisi de dades i desenvolupar solucions efectives
Dissenyar, desenvolupar i mantenir informes i panells interactius utilitzant Power BI o SSRS
Utilitzar SSIS per extreure, transformar i carregar dades de diverses fonts a un magatzem de dades centralitzat amb dades de qualitat i de manera eficaç
Identificar i resoldre problemes relacionats amb la qualitat de les dades, la consistència i la precisió
Gestionar, interpretar i calcular KPI’s relacionats amb el món empresarial
Comunicar els resultats d’aquests anàlisis al Comité de Direcció junt amb la resta de l’equip



Què oferim:


Formar part d’un equip estratègic i en ple creixement
Treballar en un ambient jove i dinàmic, amb bon clima laboral
Retribució: segons experiència aportada
Projecció de creixement i pla de carrera
26 dies de vacances més el dia d’aniversari
1 tarda lliure a la setmana
1 dia de teletreball a la setmana



Requirements:


Titulació universitària en Estadística, ADE, Economia, Física o similar.
6 mesos d'experiència en l’anàlisi de dades i visualització amb Power BI.
Experiència en programació amb SQL.
Habilitats de comunicació verbal i escrita. Capacitat per presentar els resultats de manera clara i concisa davant els diferents stakeholders de l’empresa.
Nivell alt de català i castellà.
Persona ben estructurada, amb bon pensament analític i conceptual.
Forta orientació al procés, inclosa la capacitat de traduir negocis en codi.
Fort/a jugador/a d'equip, automotivat/da amb capacitat de treballar de manera autònoma en la coordinació d'activitats transversals.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a DATA ANALYST con experiencia mínima de 3 años para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo💥




¿Quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Por qué trabajar aquí?




👉FORMACIÓN PERSONALIZADA: Dispondrás de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars y Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching...

👉MODELO DE TRABAJO HIBRIDO: 1 día oficina (zona Viladecans)

👉PAQUETE DE RETRIBUCIÓN FLEXIBLE: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).

👉SOMOS UNA FAMILIA: Cuidamos de esta gran familia organizando afterworks, cenas y eventos 🍻.




Experiencia:

Desarrollar análisis de datos complejos, aplicando distintas metodologías matemáticas y/o estadísticas para recopilar, organizar, interpretar y resumir datos numéricos para proporcionar información utilizable a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar informes y/o entregables relacionados con datos relevantes para la toma de decisiones, así como sus presentaciones a los equipos de negocio.
Apoyar al equipo de Business Insights en su desarrollo, proporcionando asistencia técnica y entendimiento entre los miembros sobre el uso eficaz de los datos y sus mejores prácticas.
Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos y B.I.).
Ser el focal en las mesas de trabajo con las áreas de negocio para mostrar resultados y avances, siendo capaz de priorizar y planificar el trabajo/proyecto que esté bajo su gestión.
Llevar a cabo investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas y utilizar enfoques de métodos mixtos para el análisis de datos, según necesidades de negocio.




Requisitos:

Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de negocio o analista de datos.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA. Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Alta capacidad analítica y manejo en modelos de datos: sólida experiencia en SQL, Python (deseable) y gestión de Big Data.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con varias áreas y stakeholders.
Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema, imaginar una solución y estructurarla.
Habilidad estructurando la información, analizándola y extrayendo datos según necesidades de negocio.
Se valorará experiencia en herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Inglés Avanzado




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países, por lo que podrás disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura, como en este caso.




💙¡SOMOS UN EXCELENTE LUGAR DE TRABAJO! Certificados por Great Place to Work.💙

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Fraude)
Description:
Somos una de las entidades financieras de referencia de crédito al consumo en el mercado español. Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos.. Estamos respaldados por el grupo Crédit Mutuel, el cuarto banco más importante en Francia, y el holding Argosyn. Ambos nos proporcionan el soporte financiero y tecnológico necesario para diseñar, vender y gestionar una amplia gama de productos de crédito al consumo, préstamos personales, tarjetas, líneas de crédito, soluciones de pago y seguros.




Estamos buscando para nuestra oficina ubicada en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Data Analyst. Tu misión consistirá en realizar las extracciones y análisis necesarios, con las herramientas estadísticas existentes, para el control y seguimiento del fraude.




Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:




Recopilar, limpiar y analizar datos históricos relacionados con el fraude u otros indicadores relevantes relacionados, para identificar patrones de fraude y relaciones entre variables.
Consolidar la información estadística de las bases de datos garantizando la calidad, la fiabilidad y la coherencia del dato con el objetivo de dotar a la Dirección de Fraude herramientas que permitan el análisis de la cartera.
Realización de pruebas y validación rigurosa de los modelos existentes, para asegurar su precisión y fiabilidad; puede incluir validación de datos, pruebas de hipótesis calibración de parámetros y evaluación de precisión predictiva.
Utilizando técnicas estadísticas y matemáticas, participa en el desarrollo de modelos que permiten evaluar y cuantificar el riesgo de fraude.
Dotar al área de estrategias para prevenir el fraude.
Realizar análisis e informes con el objetivo de dar respuesta a las necesidades de información para la realización de estudios tanto en proyectos internos del Grupo como en proyectos de otras direcciones que tengan impacto en la gestión del fraude.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Formación universitaria en Matemáticas, Estadística, Economía o Ingenierías.
Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Data Analyst en entidades financieras, preferentemente en el departamento / área de Fraude.
Experiencia participando en proyectos transversales, aportando conocimiento y soluciones desde la perspectiva del fraude.
Conocimiento técnico: SAS o SQL avanzado, Excel avanzado.
Muy valorable conocimiento de herramientas de gestión del fraude (ThreatMetrix,...).
Buen nivel de inglés y/o francés.
Persona con gran capacidad analítica, rigurosa con el dato, credibilidad técnica y buenas habilidades comunicativas para trabajar transversalmente con las áreas y proyectos de Grupo.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Incorporarte a una multinacional del sector financiero en pleno proceso de Transformación.
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico formando parte de proyectos transversales.
Amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 2 días de teletrabajo a la semana.
Un completo paquete de compensación que incluye: contrato estable, salario fijo, variable, tickets restaurant y otros beneficios sociales.
Show more

  • Incorporarte a una multinacional del sector financiero en pleno proceso de Transformación.
  • Formar parte de un equipo dinámico formando parte de proyectos transversales.
  • Amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
  • Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 2 días de teletrabajo a la semana.
  • Un completo paquete de compensación que incluye: contrato estable, salario fijo, variable, tickets restaurant y otros beneficios sociales.

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

  • Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
  • Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
  • Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
  • Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
  • Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Data Analyst Freelance en Barcelona
Description:
En HAYS estamos colaborando con una compañía especializada en el desarrollo y producción de Masterbatch de Color y Aditivos para el refinado de plásticos. El grupo surge de la fusión en la misma casa de marcas de: Galloplast, NCA y Vanoplast, que son marcas complementarias, muy bien posicionadas en el mercado de Masterbatch y aditivos. Esta unificación es una excelente oportunidad para mostrar la profundidad, amplitud y potencia de todas nuestras marcas, ofrecer productos de alto valor añadido, una amplia gama de servicios y soluciones, última tecnología en maquinaria de dispersión de color y alta capacidad de industrialización de cara a proyectos de gran magnitud y complejidad. La compañía tiene su sede en Barcelona (España) y otras plantas de producción en Pamplona (España) y Aviñón (Francia), oficinas de ventas y agentes en toda Europa y el norte de África, lo que le permite responder con rapidez y flexibilidad a las solicitudes de los clientes.




Actualmente estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst Freelance para dar soporte en un proyecto de implementación de ERP interno.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Gestión y Recopilar, procesar y analizar datos relevantes para diversas áreas del negocio del cliente.
Generar informes y dashboards que proporcionen insights accionables para la toma de decisiones.
Colaborar con el departamento financiero y de operaciones del cliente para identificar necesidades y oportunidades de mejora a través del análisis de datos.
Participar en la planificación, ejecución y seguimiento de proyectos de digitalización del cliente.
Implementar soluciones tecnológicas que mejoren la eficiencia operativa y la calidad del servicio.
Documentar procesos y procedimientos digitales para asegurar su correcta aplicación y continuidad.
Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener aplicaciones y herramientas de software internas para el cliente.
Garantizar que las herramientas desarrolladas se alineen con los objetivos del negocio y las necesidades de los usuarios finales del cliente.
Realizar pruebas de funcionalidad y asegurar la calidad del software antes de su implementación.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los departamentos financiero y de operaciones del cliente para entender sus necesidades y desarrollar soluciones tecnológicas adecuadas.
Proporcionar soporte técnico y formación a los usuarios finales sobre las herramientas desarrolladas.
Facilitar la comunicación y coordinación entre los equipos del cliente y la empresa subcontratante para asegurar la alineación de objetivos y prioridades.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos?

Perfil en Informática, Ingeniería de Sistemas, Ingeniería industrial o un campo relacionado.
Experiencia en tecnologías de bases de datos (SQL), Excel avanzado (DAX, conexiones a BBDD, VBA) y herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI).
Experiencia con el proceso ETL.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos, proyectos de digitalización.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Proyecto estable como Freelance.
Modalidad de trabajo: al principio se iría a oficina por formaciones y después más flexible en cuanto al remoto.
Ubicación: Vacarisses, Barcelona.
40 hrs/semanales flexible.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
We are a high energy team of product driven operators - who love to move fast. We are a flat organisation where the best idea wins and enjoy quick decision-making. We value human connection, kindness and the desire to constantly improve ourselves. 




Honei is redefining the dining experience through the most powerful solution to order & pay in restaurants and is already leading the Spanish market within one year of launch. Our platform is swiftly becoming the central hub for restaurant front-office operations and the primary channel for all hospitality payments. Our vision extends beyond payments, and over the next few quarters we are preparing to be the first company to digitise the restaurant end-customer journey at scale. 




Role: Data Analyst Intern

Location: Barcelona 

Start Date: Immediate




🫱🏼‍🫲🏼 You are responsible for…

Understanding the data structure of the company across sales, account management and business operations
Exposure to SQL, advanced Google sheets and Looker is appreciated
Creating and managing the data pipelines across NoSQL, Looker and Google Drive and sheets
Creating autonomous dashboards and automations that scale with time and create mechanisms to highlight potential opportunities and detractors using various integrations with Notion, Slack, Zapier, etc.
Run insightful ad-hoc analysis as the business needs and package insights into actions
Being the first person on the team, you are going to influence recruiting




💼 You are…

You are a self-starter, hands on and are will to learn, unlearn and relearn. You are curious and are always excited by the potential to learn new things.
You have learning or basic experience in data analysis. Exposure to tools like advanced google sheets, python, looker is a plus.
You are aware of the fundamentals of MongoDB (not a must)
You are keen and have some exposure in high-growth startups, established marketplace companies, or online grocery chains is a plus but not mandatory
Native level of Spanish and basic business proficiency in English is mandatory. Catalan is a plus.
Ability to work collaboratively across teams.




🎯 Your benefits…

High personal and professional growth opportunities
Direct exposure to C-suite internally and externally with some of the top executives of the industry
Work in one of the best offices in Barcelona with unlimited drinks
Great team culture and monthly get-togethers




🗓️ Your interview process…

1. Interview with recruiting manager (30’): Here we would love to learn more about you, your experience and motivation to join Honei. And also why Honei, why not some other early stage company? Pre-reads and research are always a plus.

2. Interview with our COO (45’): Here the conversation will get more technical, and we will get deeper into your experience. We may give you on-spot problems to evaluate your thinking process. 

3. Cultural fit with CEO (30’)




We are a driven team - who likes to move fast and get things done. Come join us if you feel strongly that you fit this role.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
For one of our best clients, we are looking for a Data analyst to participate in a large business finance transformation program with experience with Python, databases and SQL.

Requirements:

University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics or equivalent
Mid-level profile with experience with Python, databases and SQL
Finance background, working with business finance logics
Fluent English.
Collaboration and communication with the team is very important

Desirable:

Experience with Databricks
Experience with Pyspark
Experience as a Finance Controller is good to have

Conditions:

Contract: Freelance/Contractor (with Huxley)

Location: Barcelona (hybrid working)

Duration: Start September, End March 2025, possible extension (long-term project)

Please, if you are interested in this opportunity and you think that you match the profile, apply to this advertisement and we will contact you as soon as possible for talking about the rest of the details.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world’s largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron’s, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor’s Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

Position Overview

Dow Jones is seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to join our B2C data team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and a deep understanding of digital analytics. This role will be instrumental in leveraging GA4 & other sources of marketing, web, & app data to create a cohesive set of reports and dashboards usable by a variety of stakeholders. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Utilize Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics across various digital marketing channels, including but not limited to website traffic, user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates.
Ensure data quality. Prioritize and execute best practices to ensure data validation, integrity, and accuracy across various analytical tools and processes, including GA4, Adobe Analytics, and other data solutions.
Combine multiple data sources such as Google Campaign Manager, GA4 and others to provide holistic reporting and deeper insights into marketing programs.
Develop and maintain daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and build new dashboards or custom reports using GA4, or other approved data visualization tool leveraging BigQuery and our Data Lakes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of web & app data and marketing initiatives to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, across Marketing, Technology, and Product to support marketing and product initiatives with available data.
Work with technical teams to implement and manage data layer and data tags to meet marketing and analytics needs, ensuring they provide consistent and reliable data sources.
Assist our data engineering team in conjunction with our data teams to help classify our data architecture for use with various reporting and database tools.
Be a steward of our data governance and data privacy requirements; erring on validation with key stakeholders first to ensure accuracy of data is provided, reduce misinterpretation of data, and prevent misuse or dissemination of sensitive data.
Document and make transparent to stakeholders the data quality, sources, and methodology and requirements of projects delivered.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on how to effectively utilize GA4 and interpret marketing analytics data to drive business results.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital analytics and GA4, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Previous Experience in web/app analytics, with a focus on Google Analytics (GA4 experience preferred).
Proficient in SQL for data analysis, with a strong understanding of fundamentals, proficient in writing optimized queries, managing datasets, and leveraging advanced features for efficient data solutions.
Experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS), data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R, and data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.
Knowledge of Google Campaign Manager and Display & Video 360 (DV360) preferred
Experience with audience segmentation/management platforms (CDP, CRM, etc) preferred
Strong understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing.
Knowledge of tag management tools, such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager preferred.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.

Req ID: 42409

Title: Global Data Analyst
Description:
Who We are

Our mission is to “make the healthcare experience more human”. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of €130 million to date.

“Culture eats strategy for breakfast” according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We’re looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.



Job Description



Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.


Qualifications



What will help you thrive:

3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
A good excellent understanding of SQL
An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
You have some experience in Machine Learning


Additional Information



Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with Aïnhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & José Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, José and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
Gym membership (reduced price)
Health Insurance paid by the company
Flexible retribution plan benefits
Mental health program (iFeel)
23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ❤️

Show more
HTML:
Who We are

Our mission is to “make the healthcare experience more human”. Docplanner is a SaaS tool for doctors and clinics used to optimize their patient flow, reduce no-shows, and digitize their practices to be able to spend more time with the patient. We also operate marketplace-websites in 12 countries which serve 62 million patients monthly to easily find the right doctor and book an appointment. Only last month 5 mln medical visits were booked via our websites. That makes us the world's leading marketplace connecting doctors and patients. We have been growing rapidly and are on a path to reach EUR 0.5 bln in ARR in the next 3-5 years!

Docplanner was founded in 2012 in Poland. Our team now numbers over 2000 people based across 9 offices in Warsaw, Munich, Barcelona, Istanbul, Rome, Mexico City, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro and Bologna. It is backed by leading venture capital funds including Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Private Capital, and One Peak Partners, raising a total of €130 million to date.

“Culture eats strategy for breakfast” according to Peter Drucker. We believe in that. We’re looking for exceptional people who can help us change the world while building an amazing company. One of those is the Global Data Analyst, Sales Operations.

Job Description

Role Overview

Join us as the Global Data Analyst- Sales within our Global Sales Operations team whose main goal is to increase the Productivity of Sales and Expansion across all segments and markets. Reporting directly to the Global CSO, you will play a pivotal role in our organization. Your primary responsibility leverage data analytics to optimize sales strategies and expansion efforts. This includes conducting thorough data analysis, crafting and executing queries, developing strategic dashboards, participating in or leading machine learning projects, and evaluating A/B testing results to drive impactful business decisions.

What you will do:

  • Analyze and Communicate Data Insights: Thoroughly examine data sources to identify issues, interpret trends and patterns, and communicate these insights. Enhance your understanding of our database by studying other analysts' SQL queries, codes, and models.
  • Drive Innovation and Execution: Merge business insights with deep data understanding to develop new ideas. Execute these through writing optimized queries, calculating new metrics, building sophisticated reporting and operational monitoring systems, and creating both strategic and tactical dashboards.
  • Develop Machine Learning Models: Participate in the design and development of ML models, sharpening your skills in various decision-making algorithms to support and lead data-driven projects.
  • Lead A/B Testing Initiatives: Design, prepare, and analyze A/B tests, then communicate the results to business stakeholders to inform decision-making.

Qualifications

What will help you thrive:

  • 3+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role
  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics is preferred but not mandatory
  • Excellent critical thinking, comprehension, and communication skills
  • Proactive, results-oriented, with a hands-on approach to problem-solving
  • A good excellent understanding of SQL
  • An excellent understanding of data analysis in Python
  • Experience with data visualization solutions (i.e. Tableau, etc.)
  • Fluent in English (verbal and written)

Extra credit

  • You speak one additional language amongst the following: Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Polish
  • You have some experience in Machine Learning

Additional Information

Logistics

In this role, you'll be reporting to Cem Yucelten (Global Chief Sales Officer)

This is a role on the Global Docplanner Team.

Process of getting to know each other (preliminary)

1. 30' minute Interview with Aïnhoa Hameeuw (Global Talent Partner)
2. 60' minute Interview with Imanol Goicoechea (BI Analyst) & José Ghiringhelli (Project Manager)
3. Business Case to be prepared & presented to: Cem, José and Imanol
4. References & Offer

Benefits

  • Share options plan after six months working with us, vesting in 5 years (subject to separate ESOP agreement and plan)
  • Gym membership (reduced price)
  • Health Insurance paid by the company
  • Flexible retribution plan benefits
  • Mental health program (iFeel)
  • 23 days of holiday per year (on top of bank holidays, plus your birthday off on top)

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. ❤️

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Find your place at Amaris Consulting as a Network Engineer in Barcelona. Start your new adventure in an international and agile Environment by identifying opportunities for improvement at the technical, functional, and organizational levels.




Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With a tailor-made career path, develop your skills and work on challenging projects for one of our more than 1000 clients across the globe. Being 6,350 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries you will feel part of our talented and international community. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information Systems & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences, and Engineering.




We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is in step with you to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.







👉WHAT WILL YOU DO? 👈

·      Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities

·      Prioritize needs coming from stakeholders

·      Perform functional research and design to determine possible solutions

·      Construct ad-hoc financial models and analyses to support deliverables

·      Perform functional testing and user acceptance testing

·      Conduct data discovery and profiling for fit and gap analysis

·      Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty

·      Actively contribute to team ceremonies including: sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives

·      Demonstrate a strong ownership in understanding business needs and driving business valued outcome

·      Communicate on outcomes to stakeholders to ensure understanding of progress and potential roadblocks.







👉WHAT DO WE NEED? 👈




·      University degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or equivalent

·      5+ years of accounting or finance experience

·      2+ years of hands on experience with SAP ECC or S/4

·      Excellent proficiency with Microsoft Excel

·      Comfortable writing SQL queries

·      Passionate about learning everyday

·      Customer satisfaction & Business oriented

·      Strong communication skills

·      Experience with PySpark

·      Fluent in English




Preferred qualifications:

·      Experience with AWS

·      Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)







🚀WHY US? 🚀




We are people with dreams and motivations like you, desiring to work on projects that project us to the top and push us to improve ourselves to the best. Working next to super-talented people with whom we can share knowledge, and experiences, hang out and feel the support of our colleagues and managers. We care about our consultants, and that’s why we can offer:




Join a fast-growing global group with a turnover of €565M and over 1,000 clients across the world

Be part of an international, multicultural environment of 7,750 talented people from over 60 countries and 5 continents, being able to benefit from international mobility opportunities and progress your career worldwide, and/or experience other departments and sectors.

Flexibility is the order of the day, so we have friendly remote policies, an intensive workday, as well as social benefits such as Transit, Restaurant or Kindergarten ticket, and Private Health Insurance

Explore opportunities to grow quickly with a tailor-made career path and salary evaluation: 70% of our key senior talent joined the company at entry level

Develop your skills with our Tech Academy catalogue in last technologies, access the Udemy E-learning Platform with over 500 training courses, which includes programs in interpersonal communication, team management, and project management, and participate in our Webinars and Workshops.

Choose your own training course with your annual personal budget and take advantage of our partners getting certifications paid for by the company.

Feel part of our Community by being part of our Languages sessions, Team buildings, Afterword hangouts, and the Event of the Year.

We have the We Care program, where the company aid critically affected employees.

Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally.




Check for more opportunities on our website: https://careers.mantu.com/jobs




Equal Opportunity⚖️:




Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Analyst to join our IT team.

This position is available in Barcelona, Spain.

Key Responsibilities


Configure and use BigQuery
Configure and use PowerBI
Check, correct and ensure the reliability of all data
Make some dashboards for the team
Create, manage and use an ETL (Astera, Talend etc.)


Technical Stack


BigQuery
PowerBI
Metabase / MySQL
ElasticSearch


Profile

The role

The Perfect Future Team Member


Language skills: Fluent in English AND French minimum
Be proactive
Suggest system upgrades based on data
Report regularly to your manager


Why join us?


To enjoy opportunities for professional development
To be part of a supportive, collaborative & human-sized team
To evolve in a innovative environment


And above all: If you like to learn in an enriching environment with a start up spirit: then don't wait any longer to apply!

Benefits


Full-time permanent contract
Salary between 35K and 50K depending on experience
Full teleworking possible
Dynamic coworking in Barcelona / Bordeaux

Title: Data Strategy Analyst
Description:
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche Börse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! 📚Your work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.







About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information 🚀

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition…one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition 🪴




What You’ll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals.
Identify opportunities for process enhancements




Location

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona 🌍

Way of Working: Hybrid




What You’ll Need

Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)







Nice To Have

Experience in a start-up and/or tech company
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Additional hands-on technical experience an asset (GitHub, APIs, DBT, web-scraping)
A deep understanding of the industry and business operations is a plus




Benefits

Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare cover
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces




More About Clarity AI ⭐

Clarity AI’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

Clarity AI has received several awards:

The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2023-2024
Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela




Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Show more
